meta.name: Batch Convert CAD/BIM Files to XLSX/DAE with Validation and Reporting

parameters.content:
## üìã Quick Start Guide

**1Ô∏è‚É£ Configure Settings**
Edit "Set Configuration Parameters":
- `converter_path`: Path to RvtExporter.exe
- `source_folder`: Your CAD files location
- `output_folder`: Where to save results
- `file_extension`: .rvt, .ifc, .dwg, or .dgn

**2Ô∏è‚É£ Run Pipeline**
Click "Execute Workflow"

**3Ô∏è‚É£ Get Results**
‚úÖ Excel data files
‚úÖ 3D DAE models
‚úÖ HTML report

## üéì Video Tutorials

**üìπ [CAD-BIM Pipeline Tutorial](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PMTZNRFjD6c)**
Complete walkthrough of CAD-BIM automation

**‚ö° [Automated Validation](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p84AmP2dcvg)**
Stop manual BIM checking forever

üí° **Pro tip:** Watch before first run!

## üéØ Use Cases

**Weekly Reports**
Automate Monday conversions

**Quality Control**
Validate before client delivery

**Archive Projects**
Convert old files to lightweight formats

**BI Integration**
Feed Excel data to Power BI

‚≠ê **If you find our tools helpful**, please consider starring our repository on [GitHub](https://github.com/datadrivenconstruction/cad2data-Revit-IFC-DWG-DGN-pipeline-with-conversion-validation-qto). **Your support helps us** improve and continue developing open solutions for the community!

## üìã Options Parameter Configuration Guide

## üéØ Overview
The Options parameter allows you to customize the export process with various flags and settings. Multiple options can be combined using spaces.

## üöÄ Available Options

### üì¶ Export Modes
| Mode   | Description |
|------|-------------|
| `basic`   |  Minimal export with essential data only |
| `standard`   | Default export level with standard properties |
| `complete`   | Full export including all available data |
| `custom`   | Custom export using category file specification |

### üõ†Ô∏è Feature Flags
| Option | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| `bbox` | Add BoundingBox geometry of each element in XLSX |
| `schedule` | Export all Schedules |
| `sheets2pdf` | Export all Sheets to PDF format |
| `[<output file>]` | Specify custom output file path |
| `[<category file>]` | Text file with category names (required for custom mode) |

### üö´ Disable Options
| Option | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| `-no-xlsx` | Disable export to .xlsx format |
| `-no-collada` | Disable export to .dae format |

---

## üí° Usage Examples

### Example 1: **Basic Export with BoundingBox**
```bash
Options: bbox basic
```
> Exports basic data with BoundingBox geometry included

### Example 2: **Complete Export with Schedules**
```bash
Options: complete schedule sheets2pdf
```
> Full data export including all schedules and sheets converted to PDF

### Example 3: **Custom Mode with Category File**
```bash
Options: custom categories.txt bbox
```
> Custom export using categories.txt file with BoundingBox geometry

### Example 4: **Export Without Specific Formats**
```bash
Options: standard -no-xlsx -no-collada
```
> Standard export excluding XLSX and Collada formats

### Example 5: **Schedules Only Export**
```bash
Options: schedule -no-collada
```
> Export only schedules without Collada format

### Example 6: **Custom Output Path**
```bash
Options: C:\Output\result.xlsx complete bbox
```
> Complete export with BoundingBox to specific output file

---

## ‚ö° Quick Tips
- **Combine multiple options** by separating them with spaces
- **Order matters** - export mode should come before other options
- **Custom mode** requires a category file to function properly
- **Disable flags** can be used to exclude unwanted formats

---

## üìù Notes
- All options are case-sensitive
- Invalid combinations will be ignored
- Default behavior applies when no options are specified

parameters.content:
## üèÅ GROUP 1: INITIALIZATION

**Nodes in this group:**
‚Ä¢ Manual Trigger
‚Ä¢ Capture Pipeline Start Time
‚Ä¢ Set Configuration Parameters
‚Ä¢ Merge Pipeline Start with Config

**What happens here:**
1Ô∏è‚É£ Pipeline starts manually or on schedule
2Ô∏è‚É£ Current timestamp is captured for metrics
3Ô∏è‚É£ All settings are loaded (paths, folders, etc.)
4Ô∏è‚É£ Configuration merged with timing data

üí° **Key:** This sets up everything needed for the conversion process

## üîç GROUP 2: FILE DISCOVERY

**Nodes in this group:**
‚Ä¢ Find CAD Files
‚Ä¢ Merge Config with Search Results
‚Ä¢ Process File List
‚Ä¢ Check if Files Exist

**What happens here:**
1Ô∏è‚É£ PowerShell scans the source folder
2Ô∏è‚É£ Filters files by extension (.rvt, .ifc, etc.)
3Ô∏è‚É£ Creates a list with full paths
4Ô∏è‚É£ Validates that files were found

üìÅ **Output:** Array of file objects with paths
‚ùå **If no files:** Pipeline stops gracefully

## üîÑ GROUP 3: BATCH PREPARATION

**Nodes in this group:**
‚Ä¢ Split Files for Processing
‚Ä¢ Create Output Directory
‚Ä¢ Merge File Data

**What happens here:**
1Ô∏è‚É£ File list is split into individual items
2Ô∏è‚É£ Output directory is created (if needed)
3Ô∏è‚É£ Each file gets conversion parameters

üéØ **Purpose:** Enables parallel processing
üìä **Data added:** Expected output paths for XLSX & DAE

## ‚ö° GROUP 4: CONVERSION EXECUTION

**Nodes in this group:**
‚Ä¢ Capture Start Time
‚Ä¢ Small Delay
‚Ä¢ Execute Conversion
‚Ä¢ Calculate Conversion Time

**What happens here:**
1Ô∏è‚É£ Timestamp captured for each file
2Ô∏è‚É£ Small delay prevents overload
3Ô∏è‚É£ RvtExporter.exe runs the conversion
4Ô∏è‚É£ Processing time calculated

üîß **Command:** 
`RvtExporter.exe [input] [output.xlsx] [output.dae]`

‚è±Ô∏è **Conversion Time:** 1 Minute per 100Mb.

## ‚úÖ GROUP 5: VALIDATION

**Nodes in this group:**
‚Ä¢ Merge Data Before Verification
‚Ä¢ Verify Output Files and Get Sizes
‚Ä¢ Complete File Verification

**What happens here:**
1Ô∏è‚É£ All conversion data is consolidated
2Ô∏è‚É£ PowerShell checks if outputs exist
3Ô∏è‚É£ File sizes are measured
4Ô∏è‚É£ Success/failure status determined

**Success criteria:**
‚Ä¢ Both XLSX and DAE files exist
‚Ä¢ File sizes > 0 bytes
‚Ä¢ No conversion errors

## üìä GROUP 6: REPORTING

**Nodes in this group:**
‚Ä¢ Generate HTML Report
‚Ä¢ Prepare Binary Data
‚Ä¢ Save HTML File

**What happens here:**
1Ô∏è‚É£ All results compiled into statistics
2Ô∏è‚É£ Professional HTML report generated
3Ô∏è‚É£ Report saved to output folder

**Report includes:**
‚Ä¢ Success rate & metrics
‚Ä¢ Processing times
‚Ä¢ File sizes & links
‚Ä¢ Detailed conversion log

## üéØ GROUP 7: FINALIZATION

**Nodes in this group:**
‚Ä¢ Verify and Prepare Path
‚Ä¢ Open HTML Report
‚Ä¢ Final Completion Notice

**What happens here:**
1Ô∏è‚É£ Report path normalized for Windows
2Ô∏è‚É£ HTML report opens in browser
3Ô∏è‚É£ Success message displayed

**Final output:**
‚Ä¢ Report auto-opens
‚Ä¢ Summary in console
‚Ä¢ All files ready for use

## üìù Configuration Example

```
converter_path: 
C:\DDC_Converter\RvtExporter.exe
source_folder: 
C:\Projects\Building_A
output_folder: 
C:\Projects\Converted
file_extension: .rvt
include_subfolders: false
```

## ‚¨áÔ∏è Only modify the variables here  
‚Äî everything else works automatically
